title: lsfhv
author: lsfhv
content: Hi, As the title says; My Bitcoind hardly ever downloads the blockchain completely, I'm always 1 or 2 blocks behind. Does anyone know what could cause this? Thanks in advance!

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: It's most likely because the block height and blocks themselves are sent separately from each peer, so a node might receive the height first and the RPC's or GUI's realtime calculation says it's missing a single block, hence not a 100% verified chain.

comments.author: nc50lc
comments.body: Quote from: lsfhv on September 13, 2022, 12:22:58 PMAs the title says; My Bitcoind hardly ever downloads the blockchain completely, I'm always 1 or 2 blocks behind. How can you tell?Was the height indicated in the latest "UpdateTip" lower than the other nodes/BlockExplorers?

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: nc50lc on September 13, 2022, 03:09:11 PMQuote from: lsfhv on September 13, 2022, 12:22:58 PMAs the title says; My Bitcoind hardly ever downloads the blockchain completely, I'm always 1 or 2 blocks behind. How can you tell?Here's mine: blockheight.txt. Updated every 4 seconds (until I remove the file).

comments.author: DaveF
comments.body: How powerful is the machine you are running it on? Could it be that it's taking a REALLY long time to process blocks and until there is a long amount of time between blocks it just can't keep up?Same with bandwidth, blocks are only a couple of megs but if you are on a slow connection with another PC on the network streaming netflix & youtube....The clock being off should not matter, unless it's REALLY off. I have seen some odd behavior when that happens.-Dave
